Materiality Assessment  
In 2017 , K&S conducted its first formal materiality assessment  which involve d over 90 internal 
stakeholders across six sites . In 2018, K&S suppliers and community partners were engaged to develop  
a broader understanding of the impacts of its business.  
The result s of the engagement  affirmed the material  and additional EESG matters selected in the prior 
year . The same set of EESG matters will be reported this year.

External Stakeholder  
Engagement  
K&S reached out to key suppliers and 
community partners for their inputs on its 
sustainability efforts in 2018.  
 
Those inputs were taken into 
consideration and reviewed against 
existing nine EESG matters. In subsequent 
reports, reviews will be conducted to 
ensure continued relevance.    
 
 
 
In 2017, an exhaustive list of potential EESG 
matters  generated through peer benchmarking 
and desktop research was distributed to some 97 
key internal stakeholders across six K&S sites for 
prioritization.  
 
Nine EESG matters (five material matters and 
four additional matters) resulted from this 
exercise were subsequently presented to the 
Executive Leadership Team (ELT) for approval.
